member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption
member.summary: Specifies when compute nodes may be removed from a pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption.Requeue
member.summary: Terminate running tasks and requeue them. The tasks will run again when the job is enabled. Remove nodes as soon as tasks have been terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption.Terminate
member.summary: Terminate running tasks. The tasks will not run again. Remove nodes as soon as tasks have been terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption.TaskCompletion
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete. Schedule no new tasks while waiting. Remove nodes when all tasks have completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeDeallocationOption.RetainedData
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete, then wait for all task data retention periods to expire. Schedule no new tasks while waiting. Remove nodes when all task retention periods have expired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeFillType
member.summary: Specifies how tasks should be distributed across compute nodes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeFillType.Spread
member.summary: Tasks should be assigned evenly across all nodes in the pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeFillType.Pack
member.summary: As many tasks as possible (maxTasksPerNode) should be assigned to each node in the pool before any tasks are assigned to the next node in the pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeFillType.Unmapped
member.summary: The service reported an option that is not recognized by this version of the Batch client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeRebootOption
member.summary: Specifies when to reboot a compute node and what to do with currently running tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeRebootOption.Requeue
member.summary: Terminate running tasks and requeue them. The tasks will run again when the job is enabled. Restart the compute node as soon as tasks have been terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeRebootOption.Terminate
member.summary: Terminate running tasks. The tasks will not run again. Restart the compute node as soon as tasks have been terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeRebootOption.TaskCompletion
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete. Schedule no new tasks while waiting. Restart the compute node when all tasks have completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeRebootOption.RetainedData
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete, then wait for all task data retention periods to expire. Schedule no new tasks while waiting. Restart the compute node when all task retention periods have expired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeReimageOption
member.summary: Specifies when to reimage the compute node and what to do with currently running tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeReimageOption.Requeue
member.summary: Terminate running tasks and requeue them. The tasks will run again when the job is enabled. Reimage the compute node as soon as tasks have been terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeReimageOption.Terminate
member.summary: Terminate running tasks. The tasks will not run again. Reimage the compute node as soon as tasks have been terminated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeReimageOption.TaskCompletion
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete. Schedule no new tasks while waiting. Reimage the compute node when all tasks have completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeReimageOption.RetainedData
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete, then wait for all task data retention periods to expire. Schedule no new tasks while waiting. Reimage the compute node when all task retention periods have expired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState
member.summary: The state of a compute node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Idle
member.summary: The compute node is not currently running a task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Rebooting
member.summary: The compute node is rebooting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Reimaging
member.summary: The compute node is being reimaged.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Running
member.summary: The compute node is running one or more tasks (other than the start task).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Unusable
member.summary: The compute node cannot be used for task execution due to errors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Creating
member.summary: The Batch service has obtained the underlying virtual machine from Azure Compute, but it has not yet started to join a pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Starting
member.summary: The Batch service is starting on the underlying virtual machine.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.WaitingForStartTask
member.summary: The start task has started running on the compute node, but waitForSuccess is set and the start task has not yet completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.StartTaskFailed
member.summary: The start task has failed on the compute node (and exhausted all retries), and waitForSuccess is set. The node is not usable for running tasks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Unknown
member.summary: The Batch service has lost contact with the compute node, and does not know its true state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.LeavingPool
member.summary: The compute node is leaving the pool, either because the user explicitly removed it or because the pool is resizing or autoscaling down.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.ComputeNodeState.Offline
member.summary: The Batch service will not schedule any new tasks on the compute node.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableComputeNodeSchedulingOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do with currently running tasks when disable task scheduling on the compute node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableComputeNodeSchedulingOption.Requeue
member.summary: Terminate running tasks and requeue them. The tasks will run again when the job is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableComputeNodeSchedulingOption.Terminate
member.summary: Terminate running tasks. The tasks will not run again.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableComputeNodeSchedulingOption.TaskCompletion
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete. Schedule no new tasks while waiting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableJobOption
member.summary: Specifies what to do with active tasks during a disable job operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableJobOption.Requeue
member.summary: Terminate running tasks and requeue them. The tasks will run again when the job is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableJobOption.Terminate
member.summary: Terminate running tasks. The tasks will not run again.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.DisableJobOption.Wait
member.summary: Allow currently running tasks to complete.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobPreparationTaskState
member.summary: The state of a Job Preparation task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Running
member.summary: The task is currently running (including retrying).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobPreparationTaskState.Completed
member.summary: The task has exited with exit code 0, or the task has exhausted its retry limit, or the Batch service was unable to start the task due to scheduling errors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobReleaseTaskState
member.summary: The state of a Job Release task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobReleaseTaskState.Running
member.summary: The task is currently running.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobReleaseTaskState.Completed
member.summary: The task has exited, or the Batch service was unable to start the task due to scheduling errors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobScheduleState
member.summary: The state of a job schedule.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobScheduleState.Active
member.summary: The job schedule is active and will create jobs as per its schedule.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobScheduleState.Completed
member.summary: The schedule has terminated, either by reaching its end time or by the user terminating it explicitly.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobScheduleState.Disabled
member.summary: The user has disabled the schedule. The scheduler will not initiate any new jobs will on this schedule, but any existing active job will continue to run.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobScheduleState.Terminating
member.summary: The schedule has no more work to do, or has been explicitly terminated by the user, but the termination operation is still in progress. The scheduler will not initiate any new jobs for this schedule, nor is any existing job active.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobScheduleState.Deleting
member.summary: The user has requested that the schedule be deleted, but the delete operation is still in progress. The scheduler will not initiate any new jobs for this schedule, but any existing active job will continue to run. The schedule will be deleted when the existing job completes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState
member.summary: The state of job

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState.Active
member.summary: The job is available to have tasks scheduled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState.Disabling
member.summary: A user has requested that the job be disabled, but the disable operation is still in progress (for example, waiting for tasks to terminate).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState.Disabled
member.summary: A user has disabled the job. No tasks are running, and no new tasks will be scheduled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState.Enabling
member.summary: A user has requested that the job be enabled, but the enable operation is still in progress.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState.Terminating
member.summary: The job is about to complete, either because a Job Manager task has completed or because the user has terminated the job, but the terminate operation is still in progress (for example, because Job Release tasks are running).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState.Completed
member.summary: All tasks have terminated, and the system will not accept any more tasks or any further changes to the job.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.JobState.Deleting
member.summary: A user has requested that the job be deleted, but the delete operation is still in progress (for example, because the system is still terminating running tasks).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolLifetimeOption

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolLifetimeOption.JobSchedule
member.summary: The pool exists for the lifetime of the job schedule.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolLifetimeOption.Job
member.summary: The pool exists for the lifetime of the job to which it is dedicated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolLifetimeOption.Unmapped
member.summary: The service reported an option that is not recognized by this version of the Batch client.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolState

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolState.Active

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolState.Deleting
member.summary: The user has requested that the pool be deleted, but the delete operation has not yet completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Common.PoolState.Upgrading
member.summary: The user has requested that the operating system of the pool's nodes be upgraded, but the upgrade operation has not yet completed (that is, some nodes in the pool have not yet been upgraded).

member.summary: Adds tasks to a job.
member.param: The id of the job to which to add the tasks.
The s to add.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

Controls the number of simultaneous parallel AddTaskCollection requests issued to the Batch service. Each AddTaskCollection request contains at most tasks in it. Also controls the cancellation token for the operation. If omitted, the default is used (see .)

An optional collection to receive information about the file staging process (see ). An entry is added to the for each set of tasks grouped for submission to the Batch service. Unlike single-task adds, you cannot use this parameter to customize the file staging process. For more information about the format of each entry, see .
The amount of time after which the operation times out.
member.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The add task operation runs asynchronously.

This method is not atomic; that is, it is possible for the method to start adding tasks and then fail. The collection of tasks to add is broken down into chunks of size at most , and an AddTaskCollection request is issued for each chunk. Requests may be issued in parallel according to the .

Issuing a large number of simultaneous requests to the Batch service can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel (or have specified a large MaxDegreeOfParallelism in the parallelOptions) and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx .

The progress of the operation in the face of errors is determined by behavior. You do not normally need to specify this behavior, as the Batch client uses a default which works in normal circumstances. If you do want to customize this behavior, specify an AddTaskCollectionResultHandler in the or collections.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Certificate.DeleteAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes the certificate from the Batch account.
member.param: A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The delete operation requests that the certificate be deleted. The request puts the certificate in the state. The Batch service will perform the actual certificate deletion without any further client action.
You cannot delete a certificate if a resource (pool or compute node) is using it. Before you can delete a certificate, you must therefore make sure that:

item.description: The certificate is not associated with any pools.
The certificate is not installed on any compute nodes. (Even if you remove a certificate from a pool, it is not removed from existing compute nodes in that pool until they restart.)

remarks.para: If you try to delete a certificate that is in use, the deletion fails. The certificate state changes to . You can use to set the status back to Active if you decide that you want to continue using the certificate.
The delete operation runs asynchronously.

member.summary: Adds a single task to this . To add multiple tasks, use JobOperations.AddTaskAsync.
member.param: The to add.
An optional collection to customize and receive information about the file staging process (see ). For more information see .
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: Each call to this method incurs a request to the Batch service. Therefore, using this method to add multiple tasks is less efficient than using a bulk add method, and can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx or use JobOperations.AddTaskAsync.
The add task operation runs asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudJob.AddTask(Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudTask,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior})
member.summary: Adds a single task to this . To add multiple tasks, use JobOperations.AddTaskAsync.
member.param: The to add.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
member.returns: A collection of information about the file staging process (see ). For more information see .

remarks.para: Each call to this method incurs a request to the Batch service. Therefore, using this method to add multiple tasks is less efficient than using a bulk add method, and can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx or use JobOperations.AddTask.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .

member.summary: Adds tasks to a job.
member.param: The s to add.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

Controls the number of simultaneous parallel AddTaskCollection requests issued to the Batch service. Each AddTaskCollection request contains at most tasks in it. Also controls the cancellation token for the operation. If omitted, the default is used (see .)

An optional collection to receive information about the file staging process (see ). An entry is added to the for each set of tasks grouped for submission to the Batch service. Unlike single-task adds, you cannot use this parameter to customize the file staging process. For more information about the format of each entry, see .
The amount of time after which the operation times out.
member.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The add task operation runs asynchronously.

This method is not atomic; that is, it is possible for the method to start adding tasks and then fail. The collection of tasks to add is broken down into chunks of size at most , and an AddTaskCollection request is issued for each chunk. Requests may be issued in parallel according to the .

Issuing a large number of simultaneous requests to the Batch service can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel (or have specified a large MaxDegreeOfParallelism in the parallelOptions) and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx .

The progress of the operation in the face of errors is determined by behavior. You do not normally need to specify this behavior, as the Batch client uses a default which works in normal circumstances. If you do want to customize this behavior, specify an AddTaskCollectionResultHandler in the or collections.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to stage all of the files in the given collection. When file staging begins, all instances of IFileStagingProvider are bucketized by their implementation type. This produces one collection of instances per implementation. Each implmentation of IFileStagingProvider has a StageFilesAsync() method. That method is called once with the collection produced by the bucketization step oulined above.

member.summary: Methods and properties that are inherited from the instantiating parent object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IInheritedBehaviors.CustomBehaviors
member.summary: This collection is initially populated by instantiation or by copying from the instantiating parent object (inheritance). In this model, the collections are independent but the members are shared references. Members of this collection alter or customize various behaviors of Azure Batch Service client objects. These behaviors are generally inherited by any child class instances. Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerable`1
member.summary:
Exposes enumerators for a paged collection. These enumerators support simple iteration over a paged collection of a specified type.
Paged collections are backed by one or more calls to the Batch Service. Each of these calls can return a variable sized page of data which is then consumed by the enumerator.
member.typeparam: The type of objects to enumerate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerable`1.GetPagedEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an asynchronous enumerator that iterates through the paged collection.
member.returns: The type of objects to enumerate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerator`1
member.summary:
An enumerator which exposes an asynchronous mechanism for iteration.
Enumerator instances are not threadsafe.
Each enumerator fetches the collection from the server. As a consequence, each enumerator can see different data (collection size, contents, etc.).
Care should be taken to avoid multiple retrievals of the data from the server via casual use of foreach/ForeachAsync and other collection operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerator`1.Current
member.summary: Gets the element in the collection at the current position of the enumerator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerator`1.MoveNextAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous call to advance the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.param: A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPagedEnumerator`1.ResetAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous call to set the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the collection.
member.param: A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Resizes this pool.
member.param: The desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool or removal of compute nodes from the pool. If the pool has not reached the target size after this time, the resize is stopped. The default is 15 minutes.
Specifies when nodes may be removed from the pool, if the pool size is decreasing. The default is .
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The resize operation requests that the pool be resized. The request puts the pool in the allocation state. The Batch service will perform the actual resize without any further client action, and set the allocation state to once complete.

You can only resize a pool when its is . You cannot resize pools which are configured for automatic scaling (that is, the property of the pool is true). If you decrease the pool size, the Batch service chooses which nodes to remove. To remove specific nodes, call .
The resize operation runs asynchronously.

member.summary: Enables automatic scaling on this pool.
member.param: The formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
The time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the AutoScale formula. The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .

You cannot enable automatic scaling on a pool if a resize operation is in progress on the pool.
The enable autoscale operation runs asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudPool.ChangeOSVersionAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Changes the operating system version of this pool.
member.param: The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: During the change OS version operation, the Batch service traverses the nodes of the pool, changing the OS version of compute nodes. When a compute node is chosen, any tasks running on that node are removed from the node and requeued to be rerun later (or on a different compute node). The node will be unavailable until the version change is complete.

The operation will result in temporarily reduced pool capacity as nodes are taken out of service to have their OS version changed. Although the Batch service tries to avoid changing all compute nodes at the same time, it does not guarantee to do this (particularly on small pools); therefore, the operation may result in the pool being temporarily unavailable to run tasks.
When you request an OS version change, the pool state changes to . When all compute nodes have finished changing version, the pool state returns to .

While the version change is in progress, the pool's reflects the OS version that nodes are changing from, and reflects the OS version that nodes are changing to. Once the change is complete, CurrentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.
The change version operation runs asynchronously.

When you request an OS version change, the pool state changes to . When all compute nodes have finished changing version, the pool state returns to .

While the version change is in progress, the pool's reflects the OS version that nodes are changing from, and reflects the OS version that nodes are changing to. Once the change is complete, CurrentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ODATADetailLevel
member.summary: Controls the amount of detail requested from the Azure Batch service when listing or retrieving resources, using OData query clauses.

remarks.para: Azure Batch supports OData queries, which allow the client to gain finer control over query performance by controlling which resources are returned in List operations (), and which properties of each resource are returned in List, Get or Refresh operations ( and ).

By default, if you do not pass a to a List, Get or Refresh operation, the Batch client specifies no filter (all records are returned), no select clause (all simple properties are returned) and no expand clause (associated entities are not returned). Consequently, by default, associated entity properties are null, rather than being populated like other properties. Refer to individual class documentation to find out which properties are considered associated entities and need to be expanded to be populated.

Because the OData queries are passed directly to the REST API, clause strings must use the JSON attribute names from the REST API, which are not always the same as .NET property names. For example, the .NET CloudPool.VirtualMachineSize property corresponds to the vmSize attribute in the REST API; therefore, to filter a pool list operations by VM size, you would need to write vmSize rather than VirtualMachineSize in your filter string. Refer to the REST API documentation to find out the JSON attribute name corresponding to a .NET property.
For additional information about using OData to efficiently query the Azure Batch service, see Efficient List Queries on MSDN.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ODATADetailLevel.FilterClause
member.summary: Gets or sets the OData filter clause. Used to restrict a list operation to items that match specified criteria.

remarks.para: This is an optional OData $filter expression string (see the OData specification). For example, you can restrict a operation to return only active pools with the expression state eq 'active'.
Filters must be specified using REST API attribute names, not .NET property names.
The default is no filter expression, which means all resources are returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ODATADetailLevel.SelectClause
member.summary: Gets or sets the OData select clause. Used to retrieve only specific properties instead of all object properties.

remarks.para: This is an optional OData $select expression string (see the OData specification). If you provide a SelectClause, then only the properties listed in that clause are populated; other properties have their default values (typically null). For example, if you perform a operation with a SelectClause of id,displayName, then each will have its and properties populated, but other properties such as will not be retrieved and therefore will have their default values (typically null).

If, when an entity was retrieved (via a List, Get or Refresh), you specifed a SelectClause which did not include the property or properties that uniquely identify the object (usually the Id property, but for the Thumbprint and ThumbprintAlgorithm properties, then any methods that access the Batch service to retrieve data or perform operations will fail. This includes most methods on the object, including and . You can still access properties (though only properties included in the SelectClause will be populated).
Selections must be specified using REST API attribute names, not .NET property names.
The default is no select expression, which means all properties are returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ODATADetailLevel.ExpandClause
member.summary: Gets or sets the OData expand clause. Used to retrieve associated entities of the main entity being retrieved.

remarks.para: This is an optional OData $expand expression string (see the OData specification). Properties containing associated entities will be null unless included in an ExpandClause. Specifically, if you perform a List, Get or Refresh and do not specify an ExpandClause, then all associated entity properties will be null. For example, if you perform a operation without an ExpandClause then the property will be null. To populate the Statistics property you must supply an ExpandClause of stats. Refer to individual class documentation to find out which properties are considered associated entities.

If you specify both an ExpandClause and a , then properties listed in the ExpandClause must be repeated in the SelectClause (because only properties listed in the SelectClause are included in the service response). (This requirement does not arise if you do not specify a SelectClause, because that means 'include all properties in the response.')
Expansions must be specified using REST API attribute names, not .NET property names.
The default is no expand expression, which means no associated objects are returned (and the corresponding properties are null).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ODATADetailLevel.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified clauses.
member.param: The filter clause.
The select clause.
The expand clause.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.IBatchRequest.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the client side timeout for a request to the Batch service.

remarks.para: This timeout applies to a single Batch service request; if a retry policy is specified, then each retry will be granted the full duration of this value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.IBatchRequest.CancellationToken
member.summary: Gets or sets the associated with this .

remarks.para: Cancelling this token will cancel the currently ongoing request. This applies to the initial request as well as any subsequent requests created due to . Cancelling this token also forbids all future retries of this .

member.summary: Gets or sets which user accounts on the compute node should have access to the private data of the certificate. This may be any subset of the values 'starttask', 'task' and 'remoteuser', separated by commas. The default is all accounts, corresponding to the string 'starttask,task,remoteuser'.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current state of the pool. Possible values include: 'active', 'deleting', 'upgrading'

member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the pool entered its current state.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool is resizing. Possible values include: 'steady', 'resizing', 'stopping'

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.AllocationStateTransitionTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the pool entered its current allocation state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.VmSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.CloudServiceConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cloud service configuration for the pool. This property and VirtualMachineConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.VirtualMachineConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual machine configuration for the pool. This property and CloudServiceConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.ResizeTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool. In a Get Pool operation, this is the timeout for the most recent resize operation. The default value is 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.ResizeError
member.summary: Gets or sets details of any error encountered while performing the last resize on the pool. This property is set only if an error occurred during the last pool resize, and only when the pool AllocationState is Steady.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.CurrentDedicated
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of compute nodes currently in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.TargetDedicated
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of compute nodes in the pool. This property must have the default value if EnableAutoScale is true. It is required if EnableAutoScale is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.EnableAutoScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time. If true, the AutoScaleFormula property must be set. If false, the TargetDedicated property must be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.AutoScaleFormula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.AutoScaleEvaluationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a time interval for the desired AutoScale evaluation period in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.AutoScaleRun
member.summary: Gets or sets the results and errors from the last execution of the autoscale formula.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.EnableInterNodeCommunication
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.StartTask
member.summary: Gets or sets a task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.CertificateReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.ApplicationPackageReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.MaxTasksPerNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.TaskSchedulingPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets how the Batch service distributes tasks between compute nodes in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.Metadata
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudPool.Stats
member.summary: Gets or sets utilization and resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the pool.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the task entered its previous state. This property is not set if the task is in its initial Active state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudTask.CommandLine

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.CloudTask.ResourceFiles

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPatchParameter.Priority
member.summary: Sets the priority of the job. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority. If omitted, the priority of the job is left unchanged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPatchParameter.Constraints
member.summary: Sets the execution constraints for the job. If omitted, the existing execution constraints are left unchanged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPatchParameter.PoolInfo
member.summary: Sets the pool on which the Batch service runs the job's tasks. If omitted, the job continues to run on its current pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPatchParameter.Metadata
member.summary: Sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata. If omitted, the existing job metadata is left unchanged.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPatchParameter.Validate
member.summary: Validate the object. Throws ValidationException if validation fails.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPreparationTask.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that uniquely identifies the job preparation task within the job. The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPreparationTask.CommandLine
member.summary: Gets or sets the command line of the Job Preparation task.

member.summary: Gets or sets a list of files that Batch will download to the compute node before running the command line.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPreparationTask.EnvironmentSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of environment variable settings for the Job Preparation task.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPreparationTask.Constraints
member.summary: Gets or sets constraints that apply to the Job Preparation task..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPreparationTask.WaitForSuccess
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Batch Service should wait for the Job Preparation task to complete successfully before scheduling any other tasks of the job on the compute node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPreparationTask.RunElevated
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to run the Job Preparation task in elevated mode. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobPreparationTask.RerunOnNodeRebootAfterSuccess
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Batch service should rerun the Job Preparation task after a compute node reboots. The default value is true.

member.summary: The lifetime resource usage statistics for a job schedule.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JobScheduleStatistics class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.#ctor(System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JobScheduleStatistics class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.LastUpdateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between startTime and lastUpdateTime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.UserCPUTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.KernelCPUTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.WallClockTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total wall clock time of all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.ReadIOps
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of I/O read operations performed by all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.WriteIOps
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of I/O write operations performed by all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.ReadIOGiB
member.summary: Gets or sets the total amount of data in GiB of I/O read by all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.WriteIOGiB
member.summary: Gets or sets the total amount of data in GiB of I/O written by all the tasks in all the jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.NumSucceededTasks
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of tasks successfully completed during the given time range in jobs created under the schedule. A task completes successfully if it returns exit code 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.NumFailedTasks
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of tasks that failed during the given time range in jobs created under the schedule. A task fails if it exhausts its maximum retry count without returning exit code 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.NumTaskRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of retries during the given time range on all the tasks in jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.WaitTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total wait time of all the tasks in jobs created under the schedule.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobScheduleStatistics.Validate
member.summary: Validate the object. Throws ValidationException if validation fails.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JobStatistics class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.#ctor(System.String,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the JobStatistics class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time of the time range covered by the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.LastUpdateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the statistics were last updated. All statistics are limited to the range between StartTime and LastUpdateTime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.UserCPUTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total user mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.KernelCPUTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total kernel mode CPU time (summed across all cores and all compute nodes) consumed by all the tasks in the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.WallClockTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total wall clock time of all the tasks in the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.ReadIOps
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of I/O read operations performed by all the tasks in the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.WriteIOps
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of I/O write operations performed by all the tasks in the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.ReadIOGiB
member.summary: Gets or sets the total amount of data in GiB of I/O read by all the tasks in the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.WriteIOGiB
member.summary: Gets or sets the total amount of data in GiB of I/O written by all the tasks in the job.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.NumSucceededTasks
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of tasks successfully completed in the job during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.NumFailedTasks
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of tasks in the job that failed during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.NumTaskRetries
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of retries on all the tasks in the job during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.WaitTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the total wait time of all the tasks in the job. The wait time for a task is defined as the elapsed time between the creation of the task creation and the start of task execution. This value is reported only in the account lifetime statistics; it is not included in individual job statistics.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.JobStatistics.Validate
member.summary: Validate the object. Throws ValidationException if validation fails.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that uniquely identifies the pool within the account. The id can contain any combination of alphanumeric characters including hyphens and underscores, and cannot contain more than 64 characters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.VmSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.CloudServiceConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cloud service configuration for the pool. This property and VirtualMachineConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.VirtualMachineConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual machine configuration for the pool. This property and CloudServiceConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.ResizeTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool. In a Get Pool operation, this is the timeout for the most recent resize operation. The default value is 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.TargetDedicated
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of compute nodes in the pool. This property must have the default value if EnableAutoScale is true. It is required if EnableAutoScale is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.EnableAutoScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time. If true, the AutoScaleFormula property must be set. If false, the TargetDedicated property must be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.AutoScaleFormula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.AutoScaleEvaluationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a time interval for the desired autoscale evaluation period in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.EnableInterNodeCommunication
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.StartTask
member.summary: Gets or sets a task specified to run on each compute node as it joins the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.CertificateReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.ApplicationPackageReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.MaxTasksPerNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.TaskSchedulingPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets how the Batch service distributes tasks between compute nodes in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.Metadata
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolAddParameter.Validate
member.summary: Validate the object. Throws ValidationException if validation fails.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id of an existing pool. All the tasks of the job will run on the specified pool. You must specify either PoolId or AutoPoolSpecification, but not both.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolInformation.AutoPoolSpecification
member.summary: Gets or sets characteristics for a temporary 'auto pool'. The Batch service will create this auto pool and run all of the tasks of the job on it, and will delete the pool once the job has completed. You must specify either PoolId or AutoPoolSpecification, but not both.

member.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the pool.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.CloudServiceConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the cloud service configuration for the pool. This property and VirtualMachineConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.VirtualMachineConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual machine configuration for the pool. This property and CloudServiceConfiguration are mutually exclusive and one of the properties must be specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.MaxTasksPerNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.TaskSchedulingPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets how tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.ResizeTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.

member.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.AutoScaleFormula
member.summary: Gets or sets the formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.AutoScaleEvaluationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a time interval for the desired AutoScale evaluation period in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.EnableInterNodeCommunication
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolSpecification.StartTask
member.summary: Gets or sets a task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolUpdatePropertiesParameter.StartTask

member.summary: Sets a list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool. If you specify an empty collection, any existing application packages references are removed from the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.PoolUpdatePropertiesParameter.Metadata
member.summary: Sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata. If you specify an empty collection, any existing metadata is removed from the pool.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Schedule class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.Schedule.DoNotRunUntil
member.summary: Gets or sets the earliest time at which any job may be created under this job schedule. If you do not specify a doNotRunUntil time, the schedule becomes ready to create jobs immediately.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.Schedule.DoNotRunAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets a time after which no job will be created under this job schedule. The schedule will move to the completed state as soon as this deadline is past and there is no active job under this job schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.Schedule.StartWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets the time interval, starting from the time at which the schedule indicates a job should be created, within which a job must be created. If a job is not created within the startWindow interval, then the 'opportunity' is lost; no job will be created until the next recurrence of the schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Models.Schedule.RecurrenceInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the time interval between the start times of two successive jobs under the job schedule. A job schedule can have at most one active job under it at any given time.

member.summary: Provides utilities to help monitor CloudTask states.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.TaskStateMonitor.CustomBehaviors
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this .

remarks.para: These behaviors are inherited by child objects.
Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous call to monitor an CloudTask collection until each of its members has reached a desired state at least once. The State of each CloudTask instance is assumed to authoritative at the time of the call. Instances that are already at the desiredState are ignored. The CloudTask instances in the collection are treated as read-only. No updates are made to any of these instances. This means that when the call completes (timeout or not) the CloudTask instances should be refreshed before using.
member.param: The collection of tasks to monitor.
The target state of the tasks. The WaitAll will exit when all tasks have reached this state at least once.
The maximum amount of time this call will wait before timing out.
Controls various settings of the monitor, such as delay between each poll.
A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied after the CustomBehaviors on the current object.
member.returns: True if the WaitAll timed out, false if it did not.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous call to monitor an CloudTask collection until each of its members has reached a desired state at least once. The State of each CloudTask instance is assumed to authoritative at the time of the call. Instances that are already at the desiredState are ignored. The CloudTask instances in the collection are treated as read-only. No updates are made to any of these instances. This means that when the call completes (timeout or not) the CloudTask instances should be refreshed before using.
member.param: The collection of tasks to monitor.
The target state of the tasks. The WhenAll will exit when all tasks have reached this state at least once.

member.summary: Begins asynchronous call to monitor an CloudTask collection until each of its members has reached a desired state at least once. The State of each CloudTask instance is assumed to authoritative at the time of the call. Instances that are already at the desiredState are ignored. The CloudTask instances in the collection are treated as read-only. No updates are made to any of these instances. This means that when the call completes (timeout or not) the CloudTask instances should be refreshed before using. If time time specified in the is exceeded a is thrown.
member.remarks: This method throws an exception if a timeout or cancellation occurs.
member.param: The collection of tasks to monitor.
The target state of the tasks. The WaitAll will exit when all tasks have reached this state at least once.
The maximum amount of time this call will wait before timing out.
Controls various settings of the monitor, such as delay between each poll.
A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied after the CustomBehaviors on the current object.
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the execution constraints provided by the user for this job preparation task.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTask.RerunOnComputeNodeRebootAfterSuccess
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that controls the rerun of the job preparation task after a reboot of a compute node which had a previously successful run the job preparation task.
member.remarks: If this property is not specified, a default value of true is assigned by the Batch Service. Note that the job preparation task should still be written to be idempotent because it can be retun if the compute node is rebooted while Job Prep Task is still running.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTask.ResourceFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of ResourceFile instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTask.RunElevated
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines the elevation state of the process. True specifies that the process is to run under elevation as Administrator. False specifes no elevation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTask.WaitForSuccess
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that specifies if the Batch Service should wait for the successful completion of the job preparation task before scheduling any tasks on the compute node.
member.remarks: A job preparation task execution is considered successful if its ExitCode is 0. If this property is not specified, a default value of true is assigned by the Batch Service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTask.Microsoft#Azure#Batch#ITransportObjectProvider{Microsoft#Azure#Batch#Protocol#Models#JobPreparationTask}#GetTransportObject
member.summary: Return a protocol object of the requested type.
member.returns: The protocol object of the requested type.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation
member.summary: Contains information about the execution of a Job Preparation task on a compute node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.EndTime
member.summary: Gets the time at which the task completed.
member.remarks: This property is only returned if the task is in completed state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.ExitCode
member.summary: Gets the exit code of the task.
member.remarks: This property is only returned if the task is in completed state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.LastRetryTime
member.summary: Gets the most recent time at which this task's execution was retried by the Batch Service.
member.remarks: This is only returned if the is not 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.RetryCount
member.summary: Gets the number of times the task has been retried by the Batch Service. Every time the task exits with a non-zero code, it is deemed as an application failure. The Batch Service will retry the task up to the specified MaxTaskRetryLimit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.SchedulingError
member.summary: Gets the TaskSchedulingError encountered by the service in starting the task.
member.remarks: This property is only returned if there was an error in scheduling the task and it is now in completed state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the time at which the task started running. Note that every time the task is restarted this value is reset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.State
member.summary: Gets the current running state of the task.
member.remarks: Running means the task is currently running. Completed means the task has completed. The Completed state includes the case where the task exits successfully with exit code 0 and the cases where the system fails to start the task process due to scheduling errors or the retry limit has reached after numerous task failures.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.TaskRootDirectory
member.summary: Gets the root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node. You can use this path to retrieve files created by the task such as log files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobPreparationTaskExecutionInformation.TaskRootDirectoryUrl
member.summary: Gets the URL to the root directory of the Job Preparation task on the compute node.

member.summary: Gets the completion time of the job schedule. This property is only returned for completed job schedules.

member.summary: Gets the time at which the next job will be scheduled under this job schedule. This property is only returned for active job schedules.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleExecutionInformation.RecentJob
member.summary: Gets the information about the most recent job under the job schedule. Note that this element is only returned if the job schedule contains at least one job under it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics
member.summary: Resource usage statistics for a .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.FailedTaskCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of tasks in the job schedule that failed during the given time range.
member.remarks: If a task exits with a non-zero exit code, it is deemed as an application error, and the system will rerun the task up to the given MaxRetryCount. When the retry count is reached, the task is deemed failed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.KernelCpuTime
member.summary: Gets the total kernel mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all the tasks in the job schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.LastUpdateTime
member.summary: Gets the end time of the time range for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.ReadIOGiB
member.summary: Gets the total gibibytes of I/O read by all the tasks in the job schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.ReadIOps
member.summary: Gets the total number of I/O read operations made by all the tasks in the job schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the start time of the time range for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.SucceededTaskCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of tasks successfully completed in the job schedule during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.TaskRetryCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of retries occurred on all the tasks in the job schedule during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.Url
member.summary: Gets the URL.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.UserCpuTime
member.summary: Gets the total user mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all the tasks in the job schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.WaitTime
member.summary: Gets the wait time for a task is the time between the task creation and the start of the most recent task execution (if the task is retried due to failures).
member.remarks: This is the total wait time across all the tasks in the job schedule. This value is only reported in the lifetime statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.WallClockTime
member.summary: Gets the total wall clock time of all the tasks in the job schedule. Note that if any task was retried multiple times, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.WriteIOGiB
member.summary: Gets the total gibibytes of I/O written by all the tasks in the job schedule.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobScheduleStatistics.WriteIOps
member.summary: Gets the total number of I/O write operations made by all the tasks in the job schedule.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Job Preparation task for jobs created via this .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobSpecification.JobReleaseTask
member.summary: Gets or sets the Job Release task for jobs created via this .
member.remarks: The Batch service runs the Job Release task when the job ends, on each compute node where any task of the job has run.

member.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with jobs created via this as metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobSpecification.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of jobs created via this .
member.remarks: Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.JobSpecification.UsesTaskDependencies
member.summary: Gets or sets whether tasks in jobs created under this can define dependencies on each other.
member.remarks: The default value is false.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.ApplicationPackageReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of application package references to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.AutoScaleEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool size should automatically adjust over time.

remarks.para: If false, the property is required.
If true, the property is required. The pool automatically resizes according to the formula.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.AutoScaleEvaluationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the .
member.remarks: The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.AutoScaleFormula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

remarks.para: This property is required if is set to true.
The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created. If the formula is not valid, an exception is thrown when you try to commit the .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.CertificateReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.CloudServiceConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the for the pool.
member.remarks: This property is mutually exclusive with .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the pool permits direct communication between compute nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.MaxTasksPerComputeNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
member.remarks: The default value is 1. The maximum value of this setting depends on the size of the compute nodes in the pool (the property).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.Metadata
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.ResizeTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.

remarks.para: This timeout applies only to manual scaling; it has no effect when is set to true.
The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum value is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.StartTask
member.summary: Gets or sets a task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.TargetDedicated
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
member.remarks: This setting cannot be specified if is set to true. It is required if AutoScaleEnabled is set to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.TaskSchedulingPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets how tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.VirtualMachineConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the pool.
member.remarks: This property is mutually exclusive with .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolSpecification.VirtualMachineSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of virtual machines in the pool. All VMs in a pool are the same size.
member.remarks: For information about available sizes of virtual machines, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-sizes-specs/. Batch supports all Azure cloud service VM sizes except ExtraSmall.

member.summary: Starts an asynchronous operation to close the current instance of . Closed instances of are unable to make calls to the Batch Service and the behavior and values of any other methods or properties are undefined. These restrictions also apply immediately to any objects that can trace instantation back to this . This method is threadsafe and can be called any number of times.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IFileStagingArtifact
member.summary: Contains information about a file staging process. File staging is typically performed for a (see ).

remarks.para: IFileStagingArtifact allows an application to customize and to obtain information about the process of uploading files to the cloud, for example as part of a task-related operation such as JobOperations.AddTaskAsync or CloudJob.AddTaskAsync. Applications may use this information to, for example, find out about containers that were created in Azure Storage as part of the upload process.

When JobOperations.AddTaskAsync is called, the Batch client sends the tasks to the Batch service in collections. As each collection is processed, the Batch client performs file staging for that collection: it examines the tasks to see if any of them specify any , and if so creates a dictionary entry for each type of in the FilesToStage collection. The key of the dictionary entry is the of the IFileStagingProvider and the value is an instance of the corresponding implementation of IFileStagingArtifact. For example, if FilesToStage includes one or more objects, then the dictionary contains an entry whose key is typeof(FileToStage) and whose value is an instance of .

When the Add Task operation completes, or during the Add Task operation if the application is multi-threaded, you can examine the dictionary and convert each IFileStagingArtifact to the appropriate type to retrieve the type-specific information. For example, if your Add Task operation specified one or more FileToStage objects, you can locate the dictionary entry keyed by typeof(FileToStage), cast the value to SequentialFileStagingArtifact, and examine the property to determine if the upload process created a blob container in Azure Storage and if so the name of that container. This example could be useful for cleaning up automatically created containers.

(Single-task Add Task operations work similarly, except that in a multi-task Add Task operation, there is a dictionary for each collection of tasks, and the dictionaries are collected in a , whereas in a single-task Add Task operation there is only a single dictionary.)

In a single-task Add Task operation, you can also use the dictionary to customize the file staging process, by pre-populating it with appropriate entries. For example, suppose you wish to control the for a group of FileToStage objects. Then you could initialize the dictionary with { typeof(FileToStage), new SequentialFileStagingArtifact { NamingFragment = "myname" } } before passing it to AddTaskAsync. The FileToStage implementation of IFileStagingProvider would then use your SequentialFileStagingArtifact instead of creating its own. (This feature is not available in multi-task Add Task operations.)

You may also encounter IFileStagingArtifact if you are developing a custom . In this case you will typically create a custom implementation of IFileStagingArtifact to report implementation-specific information about your file staging process.

member.remarks: Although a caller may set this property, the implementation is not required to respect it.

member.summary: Resizes the specified pool.
member.param: The id of the pool.
The desired number of compute nodes in the pool.

The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool or removal of compute nodes from the pool. If the pool has not reached the target size after this time, the resize is stopped. The default is 15 minutes.
Specifies when nodes may be removed from the pool, if the pool size is decreasing. The default is .
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The resize operation requests that the pool be resized. The request puts the pool in the allocation state. The Batch service will perform the actual resize without any further client action, and set the allocation state to once complete.

You can only resize a pool when its is . You cannot resize pools which are configured for automatic scaling (that is, the property of the pool is true). If you decrease the pool size, the Batch service chooses which nodes to remove. To remove specific nodes, call .
The resize operation runs asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.PoolOperations.ChangeOSVersionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClientBehavior},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Changes the operating system version of the specified pool.
member.param: The id of the pool.
The Azure Guest OS version to be installed on the virtual machines in the pool.
A collection of instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the .
A for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: During the change OS version operation, the Batch service traverses the nodes of the pool, changing the OS version of compute nodes. When a compute node is chosen, any tasks running on that node are removed from the node and requeued to be rerun later (or on a different compute node). The node will be unavailable until the version change is complete.

The operation will result in temporarily reduced pool capacity as nodes are taken out of service to have their OS version changed. Although the Batch service tries to avoid changing all compute nodes at the same time, it does not guarantee to do this (particularly on small pools); therefore, the operation may result in the pool being temporarily unavailable to run tasks.
When you request an OS version change, the pool state changes to . When all compute nodes have finished changing version, the pool state returns to .

While the version change is in progress, the pool's reflects the OS version that nodes are changing from, and reflects the OS version that nodes are changing to. Once the change is complete, CurrentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.
The change version operation runs asynchronously.

The node will be unavailable until the version change is complete.

The operation will result in temporarily reduced pool capacity as nodes are taken out of service to have their OS version changed. Although the Batch service tries to avoid changing all compute nodes at the same time, it does not guarantee to do this (particularly on small pools); therefore, the operation may result in the pool being temporarily unavailable to run tasks.
When you request an OS version change, the pool state changes to . When all compute nodes have finished changing version, the pool state returns to .

While the version change is in progress, the pool's reflects the OS version that nodes are changing from, and reflects the OS version that nodes are changing to. Once the change is complete, CurrentOSVersion is updated to reflect the OS version now running on all nodes.
This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see .
